label: BODY

text: Board of Game and Inland Fisheries
label: BODY

text: 4000 West Broad Street
label: HH1

text: Richmond, Virginia 23230
label: BODY

text: October 7, 2009
label: HH1

text: Present:  John Montgomery, Jr., Chairman and Dr. William T. Greer; Director: Robert
label: HH1

text: “Bob” W. Duncan; Chief Operating Officer: Matt Koch; Senior Leadership Team:
label: BODY

text: Ray Davis, Larry Hart, Larry Harizanoff, Charlie Sledd, Colonel Dabney “Dee” Watts
label: BODY

text: and David Whitehurst:  LDP Fellow: Prashant Dixit
label: BODY

text: The Chairman welcomed everyone and called the meeting to order at 3:30pm.
label: BODY

text: Approval of the May 11, 2009 Committee Meeting Minutes:  The Chairman called for
label: HH1

text: a motion to approve the May l1, 2009 Committee Meeting Minutes.  Dr. Greer made
label: BODY

text: the following motion:  I hereby move the minutes of the meeting be approved as
label: HH1

text: submitted.  Mr. Montgomery Second the motion.  Ayes: Montgomery and Greer.
label: HH1

text: 2010 Legislative Update:   The Chairman called upon Mr. Charlie Sledd to provide an
label: HH1

text: update on the Agency Legislative Proposals for the 2010 General Assembly.  Mr. Sledd
label: BODY

text: indicated that the agency’s nine proposals had been sent to all of the Board Members
label: BODY

text: when they were submitted to the Secretary of Natural Resources at the end of August.
label: BODY

text: September 9th was the last day for Cabinet Secretaries to screen proposals and send
label: BODY

text: approved proposals to the Department of Planning and Budget (DPB) and the Governor’s
label: BODY

text: Policy Office.  October 21st is the next deadline and is the last day for DPB to complete
label: BODY

text: full review of legislative proposals and forward comments to the Governor’s Policy
label: BODY

text: Office. November 30th is the target date for the Governor to complete review of agency
label: BODY

text: legislative proposals.  An update will be provided at the next meeting.
label: BODY

text: Mr. Montgomery thanked Mr. Sledd for his efforts in meeting all of the required
label: BODY

text: deadlines.
label: BODY

text: Presentation of the Financial Statement:  The Chairman called upon Mr. Matt Koch for
label: HH1

text: the presentation of the Financial Statement.  Mr. Koch reported on the Agency’s Budget-
label: BODY

text: to-Actuals performance for FY2009.  Included in the budget background information as
label: BODY

text: that:
label: BODY

text: • Revenue was below appropriations and therefore was the limiting factor in FY
label: BODY

text: • Operating Forecast was 99% accurate.
label: BODY

text: • Actual capital revenue was $600,000 over forecast due to a federal fisheries grant
label: BODY

text: being re-designated for Coursey Springs.
label: BODY

text: Final Page 2 of Final Page 5
label: BODY

text: • Budget adjustments were mandated by the Administration and had the desired
label: BODY

text: impact of reducing Agency expenses.
label: BODY

text: Revenue continues to be a concern for the Agency.  Boating revenue is projected to
label: BODY

text: decline in FY 2010.  The Agency plans to incorporate an Indirect Cost Rate on federal
label: BODY

text: grants that will result in capturing an additional $1,800,000 in Federal revenue and the
label: BODY

text: Pittman Robertson Fund is expected to increase 40% due to increased firearm and
label: BODY

text: ammunition sales.
label: BODY

text: DGIF will perform quarterly budget reviews and reallocate divisional budgets based on
label: BODY

text: then-current Agency priorities.
label: BODY

text: Mr. Koch noted that an appendix was attached to the handout reflecting the Revenue by
label: BODY

text: Source and the Budget to Actual Expenditures for FY 2009. A discussion was held by the
label: BODY

text: Committee and Staff on the projected revenue.
label: BODY

text: Mr. Montgomery thanked Mr. Koch for his report.
label: BODY

text: Small Purchase Charge Card Report:  Mr. Montgomery called upon Mr. John Moore
label: HH1

text: to present the Small Purchase Charge Card Report for the months of March-August 2009.
label: BODY

text: SPCC training continues for staff to improve reporting requirements with in agency
label: BODY

text: policy and state guidelines. Staff continues to perform 10% random audits of these cards.
label: BODY

text: A discussion was held between the Committee and staff on the use of the card.
label: BODY

text: The Chairman thanked Mr. Moore for his report.
label: BODY

text: Auditor of Public Accounts Update:  Mr. Montgomery called upon Mr. Moore to
label: BODY

text: provide an update from the Auditor of Public Accounts.  Mr. Moore stated an exit
label: BODY

text: interview was conducted to day with the Dr. Greer, the Director and COO.  The report
label: BODY

text: indicates only one finding- the agency does not have a documented BIA (Business
label: BODY

text: Impact Analysis).  Mr. Moore indicated this plan would be completed by the end of this
label: BODY

text: calendar year.  An update will be provided at the next meeting. Mr. Duncan thanked
label: BODY

text: everyone for their work. Mr. Montgomery thanked Dr. Greer for his participation in this
label: BODY

text: briefing.
label: BODY

text: The Chairman thanked Mr. Moore for his report.
label: BODY

text: Media Services Quarterly Report:  Mr. Montgomery called upon Mr. Lee Walker to
label: HH1

text: present the 2009 third Quarter Media Services Report. Mr. Walker highlighted some of
label: BODY

text: the numerous activities of the Information and Education Division, Information Section.
label: BODY

text: In the fourth quarter of FY2009, approximately 166 media inquiries/interviews were
label: BODY

text: fielded by the Media Relations Coordinator and 15 news releases were distributed to
label: BODY

text: Virginia outdoor writes and mainstream news media on such topics as:  White-Nose
label: BODY

text: Syndrome in bats in Virginia; Eagle Cam (joint with the Norfolk Botanical Garden) and
label: BODY

text: Operation Dry Water just to name a few.
label: BODY

text: Final Page 3 of Final Page 5
label: BODY

text: Six editions of the Outdoor Report were published on schedule, bi-monthly the second
label: BODY

text: and fourth Wednesdays of each month during this quarter.  The Outdoor Report
label: BODY

text: subscription list has grown from 16,000 subscriptions in December 2008, which it was
label: BODY

text: first launched, to 23,100 which the distribution for the June 24th edition.  During this
label: BODY

text: quarter, web production staff made significant changes to the format to enhance delivery
label: BODY

text: with faster downloads.  Major changes include: subscribers now get an introductory
label: BODY

text: email with a link to the full Outdoor Report on the internet.  This cuts down on
label: BODY

text: downloading time for subscribers, especially those with dial-up access and enhanced
label: BODY

text: formatting that allows readers to click on specific sections rather scroll through the entire
label: BODY

text: newsletter.
label: BODY

text: In addition to all of the other activities of the Division, staff participated in the National
label: BODY

text: Wild Turkey Federation annual fund raising banquet; assisted with the Butch Trinca
label: BODY

text: Memorial Turkey Hunt for Disable Sportsmen in Albemarle in partnership with NWTF
label: BODY

text: volunteers and their Wheelin’ Sportsmen Program; and the Annual Wheelin’ Sportsmen
label: BODY

text: Awards Banquet in Fishersville.
label: BODY

text: The Video production stayed active with the production of a new combo DVD featuring
label: BODY

text: Panfish Filleting and Squirrel Skinning Quick and Easy; production of  Boating Safety
label: BODY

text: PSA for the Boating Safety Education Campaign.  Videos were also sent for post on
label: BODY

text: MyOutdoorTV.com:  Looking Back, Moving Forward: Our Continuing Mission; Virginia
label: BODY

text: Conservation Police Officers and Habitat at Home.
label: BODY

text: Our Webmaster stays busy with the Agency Website now home to approximately 3,800
label: BODY

text: pages including many web-based applications that enable customer transactions and
label: BODY

text: public input.  Highlights included advertisements for use on the Virginia Tech
label: BODY

text: HokieSports.com website to promote fishing licenses and boating safety education as part
label: BODY

text: of an advertising contract which concluded at the end of the fiscal year; developed new
label: BODY

text: pages to support White-Nosed Syndrome information and developed a set of pages and
label: BODY

text: graphics to support the Department’s involvement in Operation Dry Water and
label: BODY

text: coordinated with the Angling Education and Video Production sections to begin work on
label: BODY

text: a series of “Fishing 101” videos and web pages.
label: BODY

text: The Virginia Wildlife Magazine continues to be the Agency’s flagship publication.
label: BODY

text: Magazine highlights during this quarter included hunting features about spring gobblers
label: BODY

text: and two, hunting-related land preservations stories.  Fishing features covered the James
label: BODY

text: River catfish fishery, a historical look at the Chickahominy River Fisheries, and several
label: BODY

text: photo essays.  Other features covered important Department news, such as the new
label: BODY

text: Merrimac Farm property, and a celebration of wild foods and habitat diversity.  Also
label: BODY

text: covered were a primer on beekeeping, a spotlight on the Rice Center, and a bluebird
label: BODY

text: research project.
label: BODY

text: The 2009-2010 Hunting Regulations were published during this quarter; 400,000 copies
label: BODY

text: are in the process of being distributed to the 650-plus license agents.  As a cost savings
label: BODY

text: measure, the Hunting Regulations were totally redesigned and the number of pages
label: BODY

text: Final Page 4 of Final Page 5
label: BODY

text: reduced from 80 to 56 in both the 2009 and 2010 editions.  Advertising also continued
label: BODY

text: within this year’s digest.  Both efforts will, collectively, save about a third in over all
label: BODY

text: printing and shipping cost.
label: BODY

text: Mr. Walker also covered the 2009 Lapsed Angler Direct mail Marketing Program and
label: BODY

text: preliminary results of the 2009 direct mail marketing efforts will be available in
label: BODY

text: September 2009 and a full report will be available by December 2009.
label: BODY

text: The Apprentice Hunting License Marketing Plan is in its second year and continues to
label: BODY

text: utilize VDGIF publications, such as Virginia Wildlife magazine, Hunting Regulations,
label: BODY

text: Virginia Wildlife Calendar, VDGIF Website, brochures, fliers, wallet card reminders,
label: BODY

text: new license carriers and newspaper advertising as well as press releases and story pitches
label: BODY

text: to reporters.  Marketing efforts began July 1, 2009, and continued through April 2010.
label: BODY

text: As of June 2009, 4,182 resident Apprentice Hunting Licenses and 606 non resident
label: BODY

text: Apprentice Hunting licenses have been sold.
label: BODY

text: Mr. Walker gave a brief overview of the 2009 Lapsed Hunter Direct Mail Marketing
label: BODY

text: Program. In May 2009, the Agency was notified by the National Shooting Sports
label: HH1

text: Foundation that the agency has been awarded a $79,000 one year grant.  The overall
label: BODY

text: purpose of the NSSF/VDGIF Lapsed Hunter Grant is to develop a communication or
label: BODY

text: outreach program/projects to recruit lapsed hunters.  VDGIF has partnered with NSSF,
label: BODY

text: Southwick Associates, Mile Creek Communications, and Responsive Management to
label: BODY

text: develop a comprehensive, integrated marketing approach to target lapsed hunters with a
label: BODY

text: future goal of implementing a marketing strategy to motivate hunters to by a hunting
label: BODY

text: license in the future (Fall 2010).  An update on this program will be provided at the next
label: BODY

text: meeting.
label: BODY

text: The office of boating safety has been busy preparing materials and providing information
label: BODY

text: to the public to implement the new Boating Safety Education requirement that went into
label: BODY

text: effect July 1, 2009.  The staff has developed a dockside Safety Checklist and a new
label: BODY

text: lifetime Virginia Boating Safety Education card.  Staff continues to utilize a variety of
label: BODY

text: marketing techniques to help inform the public about the new boating safety education
label: BODY

text: requirement through paid advertising, posters and other pamphlets.  This year
label: BODY

text: approximately 200 classroom courses have been held.
label: BODY

text: The Chairman thanked Mr. Walker for his report.
label: BODY

text: Internal Auditor Report:  The Chairman called upon Mr. John Allen for his report.  Mr.
label: HH1

text: Allen reported that two internal audit reports were already issued this fiscal year.  There
label: BODY

text: were no significant findings.  The annual Information Security Audit will begin with an
label: BODY

text: entrance conference next week.  The APA recently conducted a state-wide survey of
label: BODY

text: internal audit structures and hotline functions at various agencies within the
label: BODY

text: Commonwealth. Mr. Allen has provided answers to those questions.  The Chairman
label: BODY

text: asked whether the agency would receive a copy of the comparative results, and Mr. Allen
label: BODY

text: said that he would seek clarification whether the agency would receive a draft report or
label: BODY

text: Final Page 5 of Final Page 5
label: BODY

text: simply the final comparison report.  A draft internal audit plan was submitted to the
label: BODY

text: committee chairman recently.
label: BODY

text: A brief discussion was held by Committee and Mr. Allen.  The Chairman thanked Mr.
label: BODY

text: Allen for his report.
label: BODY

text: Other Business/Additional Comments: The Chairman called upon Mr. Duncan for any
label: HH1

text: additional comments.  Mr. Duncan stated the Agency received to DHS grants to purchase
label: BODY

text: Safe Boats and Equipment for the Law Enforcement Division.  Mr. Duncan thanked Law
label: BODY

text: Enforcement and Mr. Tom Wilcox for their efforts in obtaining this grant.
label: BODY

text: Mr. Duncan stated during the October Board Meeting, a full report will be presented on
label: BODY

text: the Youth Hunting Day.
label: BODY

text: The Chairman thanked Dr. Greer for his attendance today.
label: BODY

text: The Chairman announced the next meeting will be held on November 17th, 2009 at
label: BODY

text: There being no additional business, the meeting was adjourned.
label: BODY

text: Respectfully submitted,
label: BODY

text: Beth Drewery
label: BODY

text: Board Secretary
